annotations.description: The game produced by the players today wasn't one of the most inspiring. They definitely haven't shown us their best. You have to say that the visitors have been the better side. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks. On the other hand, long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the away team.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's all for today as the game is over.
Dani Alves (Barcelona) makes a rough challenge and the referee blows for a foul.

annotations.label: yr-card
annotations.description: Was it necessary? Hector Moreno (Espanyol) is shown a second yellow card for dissent and has to leave the pitch. Antonio Mateu Lahoz had no hesitation in issuing a red card!

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Hector Moreno (Espanyol) was probably a bit loose with his words to Antonio Mateu Lahoz, who decides to show him a yellow.
Jose Canas (Espanyol) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Barcelona.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 3 min. of added time.
Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle for a foul after Gerard Pique (Barcelona) hacks down one of his opponents.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Xavi (Barcelona) comes onto the pitch so that Andres Iniesta can be given a rest.
Christian Stuani (Espanyol) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!

annotations.label: attendance
annotations.description: The attendance is 30253.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The foul by Sergio Busquets (Barcelona) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Antonio Mateu Lahoz.
Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows for a foul after Javier Mascherano (Barcelona) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Jose Canas (Espanyol) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: It's time for a substitution. Ivan Rakitic (Barcelona) comes on in place of Luis Suarez.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Salva Sevilla (Espanyol) decides to take a short corner instead of crossing into the box.

Lucas (Espanyol) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Claudio Bravo. It will be a corner kick for Espanyol.
Neymar (Barcelona) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Hector Moreno (Espanyol) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Antonio Mateu Lahoz signals.
Lucas sprays a pass out to Christian Stuani (Espanyol), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Barcelona will have a goal kick.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here is a change. Victor Alvarez is going off and Sergio gives the last tactical orders to Paco Montanes (Espanyol).

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Lucas (Espanyol) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Luis Suarez (Barcelona) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Felipe Caicedo makes his way off the pitch and Christian Stuani (Espanyol) comes on as his replacement.
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Claudio Bravo is alert and denies him.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal from a mid range free kick, but the ball is blocked by the defensive wall.
Ruben Duarte (Espanyol) makes a strong challenge and Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows for a foul. Barcelona have a free kick from a promising distance.
Lucas (Espanyol) swings a cross into the box, but it's far too close to Claudio Bravo, who smothers the ball.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Salva Sevilla (Espanyol) is cleared away by the defence.
Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders. Espanyol have been awarded a corner kick.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: A substitution has been made. Rafinha is replaced by Jeremy Mathieu (Barcelona).

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Nothing comes of the resulting corner from Victor Alvarez (Espanyol). The defence is alert and manages to cut it out.
Victor Alvarez (Espanyol) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. Espanyol force a corner. They send men into the box.
Luis Suarez slides a brilliant pass into Neymar (Barcelona), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: A yellow card for a tackle by Anaitz Arbilla (Espanyol). Antonio Mateu Lahoz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: It is time for a substitution. Salva Sevilla (Espanyol) is on for Abraham.
Lucas (Espanyol) commits a rough foul. Antonio Mateu Lahoz stops the game and makes a call.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Dani Alves (Barcelona) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Antonio Mateu Lahoz's book.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Antonio Mateu Lahoz shows the yellow card to Gonzalez Soberon Alvaro (Espanyol) for a heavy challenge.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Neymar (Barcelona) quickly takes the corner kick with a short pass.

Lionel Messi (Barcelona) accepts a pass deep inside the box and after a nice touch sends the ball towards the bottom left corner. It is a pretty sweet shot, but one of the defenders changes the trajectory of the ball and deflects it onto the post. What an unlucky moment for Lionel Messi (Barcelona). He must have smashed a mirror recently. The ball goes out for a corner. Barcelona can continue in their attacking effort.
Luis Suarez (Barcelona) is caught offside yet again.

annotations.label: r-card
annotations.description: Antonio Mateu Lahoz interrupts the game and punishes the behaviour of Jordi Alba (Barcelona) with a red card.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Jordi Alba (Barcelona) says something out of turn to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Ruben Duarte (Espanyol) is penalised after knocking an opponent down.
Hector Moreno (Espanyol) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Antonio Mateu Lahoz no option but to blow his whistle.
Neymar (Barcelona) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Francisco Casilla.
Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.
The linesman raises his flag. Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) is adjudged offside.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Victor Alvarez (Espanyol) works the corner short.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Victor Alvarez (Espanyol) takes the corner, but the opposition's defence is ready and clears the ball to safety. Espanyol will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) tries to slide the ball through to a teammate but it's well blocked by a defender. The referee blows his whistle, Espanyol are awarded a corner kick.
Lucas (Espanyol) pulls the shirt of his opponent and the referee stops play for a foul.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Up to now the game has been rather average in terms of entertainment, with little in the way of thrilling moments. The visiting side is dictating the tempo in this game. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter attacks, while the away team play possession football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The match has reached half time.
That was close by Luis Suarez (Barcelona)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Luis Suarez (Barcelona) releases Lionel Messi with a precise pass and he attempts to finish, but is immediately surrounded by the defenders and loses the ball.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Neymar (Barcelona) swings in a dangerous cross from the resulting corner kick, but none of his teammates manage to outjump the defence.

Francisco Casilla pulls off a great save to deny Neymar (Barcelona), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Barcelona will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
A crossfield pass from Sergio Busquets (Barcelona) fails to find any of his teammates.
Victor Alvarez (Espanyol) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence.
Andres Iniesta (Barcelona) commits a rough challenge and Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle for an infringement.
Flag up against Luis Suarez (Barcelona). He had space to move into behind the defence, but he went too soon.
Some great controlled play and passing in the middle of the pitch from Barcelona.
Javier Mascherano (Barcelona) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Antonio Mateu Lahoz saw the whole situation.
Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) receives a well played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Luis Suarez plays a neat ball into the path of Lionel Messi (Barcelona), who makes room for a shot and sends in a low drive which bounces in off the right post! 0:2.
Victor Alvarez (Espanyol) slides a pass forward, but one of the defenders cuts it out.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sergio Garcia (Espanyol) was quite harsh and Antonio Mateu Lahoz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Barcelona are showcasing great team work by exchanging some short passes and one two passes, waiting to open the opposition's defence and hit them swiftly on the break.
Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows his whistle. Hector Moreno (Espanyol) commits a foul after dangerous play.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) fails to find a teammate across the pitch with a long ball. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Espanyol.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Jordi Alba displays great vision and sends a pass to Neymar (Barcelona), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) shows his brilliant passing ability after picking out Jordi Alba with a fine lofted pass.

Gerard Pique (Barcelona) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Antonio Mateu Lahoz with no other option than to blow for a foul.
Luis Suarez (Barcelona) finds himself behind the opposition's defence, but the game is stopped for offside.
Andres Iniesta (Barcelona) attempts a long crossfield pass, but the defence does well to intercept the ball.
Neymar (Barcelona) is adjudged offside.
Felipe Caicedo (Espanyol) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Antonio Mateu Lahoz blows for a foul.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Lionel Messi (Barcelona) is hurriedly cleared.

Luis Suarez (Barcelona) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack. Good work from Barcelona as they win a corner.
peeled away from his marker and got on the end of a cross inside the box. He attempted to head the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the keeper made a block.
The ball is cleared after Neymar (Barcelona) attempted to dribble past an opposing player.

Neymar (Barcelona) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Francisco Casilla to get hold of the ball.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Barcelona will kick off.
Today's referee will be Antonio Mateu Lahoz.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: Both teams starting lineups are available now, so you can have a look at them.

Hello to all football fans, we are here to bring you a live commentary of the following match, describing all the most interesting and important moments. We'll make sure you won't miss a thing, so just sit back and have fun.

The game produced by the players today wasn't one of the most inspiring. They definitely haven't shown us their best. You have to say that the visitors have been the better side. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks. On the other hand, long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the away team.
